items.title: Breaking: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley
items.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley this week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.title: Live: Hastie says he doesn't have support to challenge for Liberal leadership
items.description: Andrew Hastie will not contest the Liberal leadership, clearing the way for a possible challenge to Sussan Ley from Angus Taylor. Follow live.

items.title: Last-ditch deal sees government give states extra $25b in hospital funding
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising an extra $25 billion for public hospitals.

items.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
items.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: Ley issues ultimatum on Coalition reunion with temporary frontbench
items.description: The under-fire Liberal leader has given seven existing frontbenchers carriage of the portfolios vacated by Nationals, with a threat to leader David Littleproud the arrangements could be made permanent.

items.title: Live: Alcaraz takes opening set on RLA after Aussies take mixed doubles crown
items.description: Carlos Alcaraz takes an early lead against Alexander Zverev in their men's singles semifinal on day 13, as Australia's Olivia Gadecki and John Peers claim their second straight mixed doubles title. Follow live.

items.title: Australia taking Nipah virus seriously but no changes to border control
items.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

items.title: Families frayed by NDIS cuts brace for more change ahead of defining year
items.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: The US looks poised to strike Iran — but what is Trump's endgame?
items.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

items.title: Why are FBI agents seizing boxes of 2020 election documents in Georgia?
items.description: Fulton County, which votes overwhelmingly Democratic, has been a target of President Donald Trump since he narrowly lost the presidential election in Georgia to Democrat Joe Biden.

items.title: Tim Picton unable to become organ donor, brother reveals
items.description: In his first interview since the death of his brother Tim, SA's Health Minister Chris Picton reflects on the profound emotional impact of the loss on their family, his reluctance to watch the CCTV footage, and his brother's inability to become an organ donor "because of the coronial process".

items.title: Is your sunscreen application letting you down?
items.description: This is what three experts had to say about how to get the best protection from your sunscreen.

items.title: 'Traditional media is dying': Nine sells radio stations for $56m
items.description: Arthur Laundy's Laundy Family Office acquires a network that includes Melbourne's top-rating talk station 3AW, Sydney's 2GB and outspoken conservative presenters such as Ben Fordham and Tom Elliott.

items.title: Charge laid after allegedly stolen car crashes into Geelong school bus
items.description: A 43-year-old woman has been charged with handling stolen goods after a dramatic incident that saw police open fire at a vehicle that allegedly drove at officers after crashing into a bus on Thursday afternoon.

items.title: These 10 albums from 1996 changed music forever
items.description: From Weezer's raw emotion to the Spice Girls's pop revolution, revisit 10 iconic albums that made 1996 a landmark year in music. 30 years on, they still define the era.

items.title: The most popular Aussie movie in 2025 starred joeys. It's up for six awards
items.description: Ahead of next week's AACTA Awards, the makers of frontrunners Bring Her Back, Kangaroo and Apple Cider Vinegar share their thoughts on the state of the local screen industry.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: BAFTA nominations, a new cricket captain and departing pandas
items.description: Think you've been paying attention to the news cycle?

items.title: In following his own theory, man finds human remains that could be Celine Cremer’s
items.description: Celine Cremer went missing in 2023 from a track in a remote part of Tasmania's north-west. With several recent discoveries in the area, these are the theories of what could have happened.

items.title: Man whose girlfriend died from 'mixed drug toxicity' jailed
items.description: A man who injected his girlfriend with methamphetamine in the 24 hours before her sudden death has been jailed for just over nine months — but his sentence was backdated, meaning he will be eligible for release in May.

items.title: 35 GPS devices were planted in e-waste in Australia. Where are they now?
items.description: A not-for-profit environmental group put GPS devices in 35 e-waste items and dropped them off at recycling locations in four Australian capital cities. Here's what they found.

items.title: Live: Gold, silver plummet ahead of Federal Reserve announcement
items.description: The prices of gold and silver have plummeted in Asian trade as markets prepare for a surprise Federal Reserve announcement. Follow live.

items.title: The armed groups that may risk the US 'recovery' plan to control Venezuela
items.description: The US plan to "recover" Venezuela could spark a domestic backlash in a country that is already heavily divided among various armed groups that have political interests.

items.title: 'It's going to damage a lot of people': Former AIS athletes demand Channel 9 pull documentary
items.description: Former AIS athletes who claim they were physically and psychologically abused while living at the AIS have urged Channel Nine to shutter a documentary about the history of the institute.

items.title: Machine that can produce 3.6m illicit cigarettes a day seized in Sydney raid
items.description: A machine which can produce millions of black market cigarettes has been seized in a raid in north-west Sydney, as the fight against the illegal tobacco trade heats up.

items.title: Trump shares video of Alex Pretti confrontation with agents 11 days before shooting
items.description: United States President Donald Trump has shared a video on Truth Social showing Alex Pretti in a confrontation with federal immigration agents 11 days before the intensive care nurse was fatally shot during a separate encounter with Border Patrol agents.
